publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3714 Mike Rumbles: Retained Ambulance Service Trial in Braemar—That the Parliament welcomes the intention of the Scottish Ambulance Service to launch a trial retained ambulance service for Braemar on 11 May 2009; notes that, if successful, this model could be rolled out to remote and rural communities across Scotland; commends local community representatives in Braemar on their helpful approach of working with the Scottish Ambulance Service and MSPs towards a positive outcome, and wishes every success to those involved in the trial.

S3M-3714 Retained Ambulance Service Trial in Braemar (lodged on 16 March 2009) Alex Johnstone*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Elizabeth Smith*, Nanette Milne*, Kenneth Gibson*, Robin Harper*, Mike Pringle*, Sandra White*, Brian Adam*
S3M-3714 Retained Ambulance Service Trial in Braemar (lodged on 16 March 2009) Jamie Stone*
S3M-3714 Retained Ambulance Service Trial in Braemar (lodged on 16 March 2009) Jim Tolson*

S3M-3714 Mike Rumbles: Retained Ambulance Service Trial in Braemar—That the Parliament welcomes the intention of the Scottish Ambulance Service to launch a trial retained ambulance service for Braemar on 11 May 2009; notes that, if successful, this model could be rolled out to remote and rural communities across Scotland; commends local community representatives in Braemar on their helpful approach of working with the Scottish Ambulance Service and MSPs towards a positive outcome, and wishes every success to those involved in the trial. Supported by: Alex Johnstone, Hugh O’Donnell, Elizabeth Smith, Nanette Milne, Kenneth Gibson, Robin Harper, Mike Pringle, Sandra White, Brian Adam, Jamie Stone, Jim Tolson, Nicol Stephen*
S3M-3714 Retained Ambulance Service Trial in Braemar (lodged on 16 March 2009) Gil Paterson*
S3M-3714 Retained Ambulance Service Trial in Braemar (lodged on 16 March 2009) Alison McInnes*
S3M-3714 Retained Ambulance Service Trial in Braemar (lodged on 16 March 2009) Maureen Watt*
